attributes.action: Legally cap MPs pay rises at the minimum granted other public sector workers.
attributes.background: In 2015, MPs were granted a 10% pay rise but capped pay rises for others in the public sector below 1%. In 2016, MPs have granted themselves another pay rise above others in the public sector.  I propose a legally binding cap on MPs salaries at the minimum granted their public sector colleagues.

rejection.details: The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for setting the salary of MPs.
